generalInfo:
Explore some of Southern Brazil’s colonial gems and modern cities, walking the pretty cobbled streets of times gone by and visit some of the countries’ most beautiful beaches on quiet islands untouched by cars or roads.

Set against the backdrop of the Atlantic Rainforest take the opportunity to explore on foot, hiking mountain peaks, taking a scenic train ride through the rainforest – the only one in Brazil, and swimming in the crystal waters off of Ilha Grande and Ilha do Mel.

dayInfo.description: ILHA DO MEL – Portuguese for “Honey Island” This hidden paradise is only accessed by boat, with more than 23km stretch of beaches it’s a refuge for both those seeking a bit of rustic adventure and tranquillity. Vehicle free, transport options are on foot, by bike or boat, and for those looking for waves – surf board. The island as well as offering stunning beaches and nature reserves, has historical significance as once being the defender against Spanish invasion. A hike to the lighthouse at sunset is an absolute must.
